header.title: Journalism
header.desc: Plotly allows online reporters to make D3.js graphs without coding, for free, and the graphs are optimized for mobile and fluid/responsive layouts.

quotes.author: - Mike Munsell Manager, Research Marketing GreenTech Media Research
quotes.desc: With Plotly charts, GTM clients and readers have more access to our data than ever before. Plotly increases user engagement, an important metric for us as a media and research company.

sections.title: Used by some of the world's largest digital news outlets
sections.body: Plotly allows online reporters to make D3.js graphs without coding, for free, and the graphs are optimized for mobile and fluid/responsive layouts.

sections.title: A GUI for D3.js
sections.body:
Everyone knows that D3.js is the gold-standard for interactive graphics on the web. Plotly allows news outlets to rapidly create D3.js graphs without needing programmers, like this one in the Washington Post.

PLOTLY GRAPHS AT THE WASHINGTON POST

sections.title: Graphs optimized for fluid layout and mobile
sections.body:
Unlike Tableau graphs, Plotly graphs use 100% web-native technologies that display on mobile and respond to fluid layouts. See this article in VICE for example.

MURDER RATE IN VICE NETHERLANDS
SUBREDDIT TOXICITY IN VICE MOTHERBOARD

sections.title: Whitelabel Platforms with Plotly Enterprise
sections.body:
Want to run Plotly on your own servers? Plotly helps digital news outlets deploy Plotly Enterprise servers with their own branding and user experience.

PLOTLY ENTERPRISE

sections.title: Increase engagement and time-on-site with interactive graphs
sections.body: Plotly graphs are drawn in D3.js and are fully interactive - zoom, hover text, pan, and line toggling all come for free.

sections.title: Plotly Pew Research graph collection
sections.body:
Curious how publication-quality, interactive graphs look in Plotly? Explore Plotly's collection of Pew Research graphs for inspiration.

PLOTLY PEW RESEARCH GRAPH COLLECTION

sections.title: Interactive maps like the New York Times
sections.body:
Plotly has the most fully featured D3.js map editor available online. Plotly maps are all drawn with D3.js, the same Javascript library used by the New York Times.

LEARN TO USE PLOTLY MAPS
